Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-09-14T20:20:39Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Collection of Soviet Union Photograph Albums and Photographs
Tamiment Library
PHOTOS.286
2.25 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box and 2 oversize flat boxes.
circa 1930-1949 The Collection of Soviet Union Photograph Albums and Photographs contains two untitled photograph albums and photographs depicting activities in the Soviet Union and led by the Soviet state during the 1930s and 1940s. Materials are in English and Russian.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.
Scope and Content Note
The Collection of Soviet Union Photograph Albums and Photographs contains two untitled photograph albums and photographs depicting activities in the Soviet Union and led by the Soviet state during the 1930s and 1940s. One photograph album includes photographs of large-scale construction and city planning projects in the Soviet Union, likely during the Joseph Stalin era in the 1930s or 1940s. The other photograph album contains photographs from the U.S.S.R. Conference for Peace held in Moscow in August 1949. All photographs include English-language captions. The inside front cover of the album contains a sticker with the emblem of the Ernest C. Ropes Memorial Library at the American Russian Institute and signature of Harlow Shapley. Additionally, there are photographs from the 1937 Soviet film "Lenin in October". Small photographs are mostly 5" x 7." Large photographs are mostly 9" x 11" and have "MADE IN THE USSR" inscribed in the lower righthand corner. There are also photograph negatives.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Collection of Soviet Union Photograph Albums and Photographs; PHOTOS 286; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The provenance of this collection is unknown. There is no accession record associated with this collection.
Arrangement
Folders arranged alphabetically.
Related Archival Materials
Materials relating to the Soviet Union can also be found in the National Council of American Soviet Friendship Records (TAM 134).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to the fragile cover, researchers must wear gloves when handling the Construction Projects Photograph Album in Box 1.
Processing Information
In 2013, two boxes of photographs from the collection the National Council of American-Soviet Friendship Photographs (PHOTOS 054) were repatriated to the National Council of American-Soviet Friendship Records (TAM 134). Due to the unknown provenance of the remainder of PHOTOS 054, the Collection of Soviet Union Photograph Albums and Photographs (PHOTOS 286) was established as a discrete collection.
Historical/Biographical Note
The Tamiment Library, a special collection documenting the history of United States labor, radicalism, and progressive social action, accumulated this artificial collection of photographs and photograph albums depicting activities of the Soviet Union.
